Ok.  Here is as far as I have seen.  I would be more than happy if I am 
proved to be wrong, since it is going to save me a lot of trouble also.

In the JavaDoc, here is the list that I can see:
ActiveTestSuite
Assert
AssertionFailedError
ExceptionTestCase
Protectable
RepeatedTest
Test
TestCase
TestDecorator
TestFailure
TestListener
TestResult
TestSetup
TestSuite

So, there is NOTHING about the TestRunner, or BaseTestRunner or any 
sort.  I remember I checked the JUnit.org page and it states that it is 
under IBM open source public license.  So I thought that the only thing 
I can be sure is to use ONLY the classes in the JavaDoc that comes with 
JUnit.

Shane

Robert Sartin wrote:

>--- Shane Duan <sduan@...> wrote:
>
>>Because JUnit is under IBM public license 
>>
>(http://oss.software.ibm.com/developerworks/opensource/license10.html),
>
>>I think that there are some issues in using their source code (since
>>the 
>>test runners are not in the published API).
>>
>
>Huh? What "published API" are they not in? They are part of the javadoc
>and part of the source. What language in the IBM license is a problem
>for you?
>
>Regards,
>
>Rob
>
